author: COMSOL
description: A Fresnel rhomb is a prism that uses total internal reflection to manipulate the polarization of light. In this example, light in the prism is internally reflected at an angle of incidence that induces a 45-degree phase delay between s- and p-polarized radiation. By subjecting the light to two such reflections, the prism converts incoming linearly polarized light to circularly polarized light.
label: fresnel_rhomb.mph
name: root
